data.enText: that cannot be clearly seen, heard or smelt

data.chText: 微弱的光亮 / 闪光 / 光
他们沿路走远时我们听见他们的说话声逐渐模糊。
data.enText: We could hear their voices growing fainter as they walked down the road.

data.chText: 她的病还有一点点希望可以治愈。
data.enText: There is still a faint hope that she may be cured.
They don't have the faintest chance of winning.

data.chText: 软弱无力装模作样的抵抗

data.enText: feeling weak and tired and likely to become unconscious
The walkers were faint from hunger.
to not know anything at all about sth

data.chText: 我一点也不明白你的意思。
data.enText: I didn't have the faintest idea what you meant.

data.chText: 用冷漠的赞扬贬低；寓贬于褒；名褒实贬
data.enText: to praise sb/sth only a little, in order to show that you do not really like them/it
to become unconscious when not enough blood is going to your brain, usually because of the heat, a shock, etc.

data.chText: 我面前的女人突然昏倒了。
data.enText: Suddenly the woman in front of me fainted.

data.chText: 她告诉我时我吃惊得差点昏过去。
data.enText: I almost fainted (= I was very surprised) when she told me.
He fell to the ground in a dead faint.

ex.chText: 玩完过山车之后我觉得头很晕。
ex.enText: I felt quite dizzy after riding the roller coaster.

ex.chText: 鲁思开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。
ex.enText: Ruth started to suffer from dizzy spells.

synonyms.bx: 指因从高处向下看或生病等而感觉天旋地转、站立不稳的。

ex.chText: 他脸上显露出困惑的表情。
ex.enText: A bewildered expression appeared on his face.

synonyms.bx: 指因完全搞不清状况而感到困惑不已、不知所措的。

ex.chText: 她不得不再向我解释一遍，因为我完全糊涂了。
ex.enText: She has to explain it to me once again because I am totally confused.

ex.chText: 这个问题让他非常困惑。
ex.enText: He was really confused by this question.

synonyms.bx: 指对他人说的话或所发生的事感到无法理解的。

ex.chText: 蒂姆突然感到快要昏倒了。

synonyms.bx: 指因生病、疲倦、饥饿等原因而感到虚弱无力、快要失去知觉的。

data.enText: to not know anything at all about sth

data.chText: 我一点也不明白你的意思。
data.enText: I didn't have the faintest idea what you meant.

data.chText: 用冷漠的赞扬贬低；寓贬于褒；名褒实贬
data.enText: to praise sb/sth only a little, in order to show that you do not really like them/it

tr: a spontaneous loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood to the brain
pass out from weakness, physical or emotional distress due to a loss of blood supply to the brain
lacking conviction or boldness or courage
example: faint heart ne'er won fair lady
a dim figure in the distance
saw a vague outline of a building through the fog
a few wispy memories of childhood

tr: indistinctly understood or felt or perceived
example: a faint clue to the origin of the mystery

tr: lacking clarity or brightness or loudness etc
example: the wan sun cast faint shadows
the faint light of a distant candle

tr: weak and likely to lose consciousness
example: suddenly felt faint from the pain
was sick and faint from hunger

value.def: A faint sound, colour, mark, feeling, or quality has very little strength or intensity.

example.ex: He became aware of the soft, faint sounds of water dripping...
example.tran: 他开始注意到轻微的水滴声。

example.ex: The room held the faint, sweet odour of pipe tobacco...
example.tran: 房间内有烟斗烟丝的淡淡馨香。

example.ex: He could see faint lines in her face...
example.tran: 他可以看见她脸上的细纹。

example.ex: There was still the faint hope deep within him that she might never need to know.
example.tran: 他内心深处仍怀有一丝隐约的希望：她也许永远不必知晓。

value.tran: (声音、颜色、标记、感觉或特性)微弱的，暗淡的，虚弱的

example.ex: He was already asleep in the bed, which smelled faintly of mildew...
example.tran: 他已经在略带霉味的床上睡着了。

value.def: A faint attempt at something is one that is made without proper effort and with little enthusiasm.

example.ex: Caroline made a faint attempt at a laugh...
example.tran: 卡罗琳敷衍地笑了一下。

example.ex: A faint smile crossed the Monsignor's face and faded quickly...
example.tran: 一丝敷衍的微笑从那位大人脸上掠过，很快就消失了。

example.ex: Ten years ago today the US Center for Disease Control published the first faint warnings of a worldwide epidemic.
example.tran: 10年前的今天，美国疾病控制中心敷衍其事地发出了第一份警告：一场世界范围的流行病可能会出现。

value.tran: 不尽力的;敷衍的;半心半意的

example.ex: John smiled faintly and shook his head.
example.tran: 约翰微微笑了笑，摇了摇头。

value.def: If you faint, you lose consciousness for a short time, especially because you are hungry, or because of pain, heat, or shock.

example.ex: She suddenly fell forward on to the table and fainted...
example.tran: 她突然向前栽倒在桌上，晕了过去。

example.ex: I thought he'd faint when I kissed him.
example.tran: 我以为吻他的时候他会晕倒呢。

example.ex: She slumped to the ground in a faint.

value.def: Someone who is faint feels weak and unsteady as if they are about to lose consciousness.

example.ex: Other signs of angina are nausea, sweating, feeling faint and shortness of breath.
example.tran: 心绞痛的其他征兆有恶心、出汗、头昏和气短。

example.ex: One patient suffered headaches, nausea, and faintness.
example.tran: 一位病人感觉头疼、恶心、晕眩。
